title: Prince Harry breaks down on stage as he remembers Meghan Markle's pregnancy
text:

Prince Harry broke down as he paid tribute to "inspirational" children and recalled Meghan Markle's pregnancy.

During an awards do speech the Duke of Sussex spoke of how his own journey into fatherhood meant learning about those with serious illnesses "pulls at my heartstrings".

He told guests in the packed ballroom: “My wife and I feel incredibly privileged to be able to join you once again at this year’s WellChild Awards, and to be in a room with such amazing human beings.

“It has been over a decade since I first came to these Awards and every year they never fail to surprise and inspire me.

"Yet this year, it resonates in a different way, because now I’m a father.

“Last year when my wife and I attended we knew we were expecting our first child - no one else did at the time, but we did - and I remember…”

He trailed off as his eyes welled up and host Gaby Roslin stepped forward to put an arm around him and rub his arm reassuringly and hold his hand briefly behind his back.

(Image: PA)

(Image: REUTERS)

“Sorry,” he laughed, before continuing: “I remember squeezing Meghan’s hand so tight during the awards, both of us thinking what it would be like to be parents one day, and more so, what it would be like to do everything we could to protect and help our child should they be born with immediate challenges or become unwell over time.

“And now, as parents, being here and speaking to all of you pulls at my heart strings in a way I could have never understood until I had a child of my own.”

He praised the young award winners and their families, telling them: “No parent wants to hear that their child will suffer; that they will face extraordinary challenges that will affect them throughout their lives.

(Image: PA)

(Image: REUTERS)

"And yet, after meeting all of the WellChild parents and the kids themselves over the years, you’ve managed to give all of us a sense of optimism, a sense of hope and strength that no professional, no bestselling book and no amount of advice can ever give any of us.

"So thank you for being you.”

(Image: POOL/AFP via Getty Images)

Meghan later joined him on stage for a group photograph with the winners.

In the foyer of the Royal Lancaster, they stopped to chat to members of the choir from Star Primary School in Canning Town, who had won a competition to perform at the event.

The duke, perhaps relieved at having delivered his speech, chatted animatedly with the youngsters, telling them: “You nailed it! Picture perfect. Don’t ever break up this choir.

(Image: Getty Images)

(Image: POOL/AFP via Getty Images)

“Have you done any lessons for the past two weeks or have you just been singing? Shh!” he laughed.

And he encouraged the children to give his wife a hug, with four of them coming forward one-by-one to embrace Meghan, who giggled and said: “Thanks guys, you’ve made my night!”

When one boy called out: “I’m never washing my hands again!” the duke turned and said: “Guys, you are all washing your hands regularly, especially before eating food!”
description: The Duke of Sussex paid an emotional tribute to seriously ill children at the WellChild Awards in Central London
